item.title: DSA - Binary Search Tree
item.description: What is a Tree? A Tree is a data structure that has a root and subtrees of children, representing a set of linked nodes. Trees behave similarly to a LinkedList in that they have a collection of nodes starting with a head (root). The main difference is that Trees can have multiple children, whereas a LinkedList, on the other hand, can have only one next child. Iâ€™m going to focus on a commonly used type of tree, the Binary Search Tree.
